intro: Chrysocephalum apiculatum subsp. filifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf golden weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that produces small, fluffy seeds which are dispersed by the wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a subject of study in ecological research.
